author: Carl Gibson
title: 'High-level decision': Trump lawyer details plot to fly fake elector papers to DC in new recordings
text:
'High-level decision': Trump lawyer details plot to fly fake elector papers to DC in new recordings
A new batch of leaked recordings show the lengths that former Donald Trump attorney Kenneth Chesebro went to make sure so-called "fake elector" documents made it to Washington, DC in time to challenge Congress' certification of the 2020 Electoral College vote count.
CNN obtained and published the recordings from Chesebro's testimony to investigators in Michigan probing the fake electors plot. In the recordings, Chesebro told prosecutors that the Trump campaign went into panic mode when learning that the fake elector ballots from the Mitten State were still stuck in the mail and unlikely to make it to Washington, DC by January 6th. According to Chesebro, this prompted one campaign lawyer to fly the documents overnight and hand-deliver them to lawmakers friendly to their cause of attempting to overturn the election results.
"The general counsel of the campaign was alarmed, and was chartering, well, they didn't charter a jet, they did commercial ... this is a high-level decision to get the Michigan and Wisconsin votes there," Chesebro said.
POLL:
Should Trump be allowed to hold office again?
Chesebro's testimony and emails he turned over to investigators show a deeply involved plot involving the documents changing hands several times in between Michigan, Wisconsin and Washington. The fake elector papers from Wisconsin were flown from Milwaukee to the Baltimore-Washington International Airport, where a Trump campaign official and a Wisconsin Republican Party official landed with the papers in hand at approximately 10 AM on January 5.
Those two men then handed off the documents to Chesebro after meeting him at the Trump International Hotel in downtown Washington, DC for safe keeping. After that handoff, Chesebro and a separate Trump aide met with House Republican staffers to personally deliver the fake elector documents.
‚ÄúI had the Wisconsin stuff. [Trump campaign aide] Mike Brown had the Michigan stuff. We walked to the Longworth Office Building, and the guy with [Pennsylvania Rep. Scott] Perry, or whatever his name is, and some other fellow, that were like staff members of the House, took them and said, 'We‚Äôre going to walk them over to the Senate and give it to a Senate staffer,'‚Äù Chesebro told Michigan prosecutors. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know why logistically we didn‚Äôt take it directly to [Wisconsin Sen. Ron] Johnson. But that‚Äôs how we did it,‚Äù he added.In Wisconsin, state party officials were reportedly annoyed at the Trump campaign's insistence on providing a courier service to ensure the delivery of the fake elector papers."
READ MORE:
Former Trump lawyer and GA co-defendant now cooperating in 2 new 'fake elector' investigations
The Trump campaign's insistence on using a courier service to ensure the safe passage of fake elector ballots out of Wisconsin reportedly annoyed GOP officials in the Badger State.
"Freaking [T]rump idiots want someone to fly original elector papers to the [S]enate President," one Wisconsin GOP official wrote to then-party chairman Andrew Hitt on January 4.
Listen to the recordings by scrolling up or
clicking this link. And watch CNN's report on the new recordings by playing the video below or by clicking this link. author: Roc√≠o √Ålvarez
title: La moda de los restaurantes coreanos arrasa en Madrid, te dejamos nuestros favoritos
text:
Hace unos meses habl√°bamos de c√≥mo las parrillas argentinas estaban conquistando la capital. Un restaurante tras otro, no par√°bamos de ver nuevas aperturas con sabor a carne y brasa. Pero como todo en la capital, las modas como vienen, se van. Prueba de ello es la nueva tendencia en restaurantes, que parece querer desbancar a las parrillas: los restaurantes coreanos. As√≠ es, no dejamos de ver nuevas aperturas, v√≠deos en redes sociales, escuchar recomendaciones, y m√°s, de coreanos en Madrid. Y es que‚Ä¶ ¬øC√≥mo resistirse a sus deliciosos dumplings? ¬øO a su cl√°sico pollo frito? Desde los m√°s sibaritas hasta los m√°s callejeros, hoy en COOLthelifestyle hacemos una ruta por nuestros
restaurantes coreanos favoritos de Madrid. Los restaurantes chinos m√°s aut√©nticos y deliciosos de Madrid Mar√≠a Li Bao, la reina de la cocina china en Madrid El primer restaurante de Espa√±a especializado en tallarines Biang Biang
Restaurantes coreanos en Madrid
Casa Pei +
üìç Direcci√≥n: C. de Espronceda, 34
En Casa Pei +, encontrar√°s recetas de herencia coreana y china. Los padres de Sungeun Pei, su fundadora, son los encargados de preparar los wontons, que se sirven con salsa de soja dulce y picante (uno de nuestros favoritos).
Tampoco te puedes perder sus sabrosos dumplings y la ensalada de rollitos de primavera reci√©n hechos. Todo ello coronado por sus deliciosos caf√©s provenientes de Toma Caf√©,
una de nuestras cafeter√≠as de especialidad de referencia.
Yakiniku Rikyu
üìç Direcci√≥n: P.¬∫ de la Castellana, 15
Un restaurante especializado en parrilla donde t√∫ terminas de hacerte la comida cuando te apetece disfrutando una experiencia √∫nica en la mesa.
En Yakiniku Rikyu reina la delicadeza de la aut√©ntica carne de Wagyu acompa√±ada de otros deliciosos platos como entrantes, sopas y arroces a la piedra. Otro concepto de cocina japonesa tradicional que respira la influencia de la inmigraci√≥n coreana en muchos de sus platos.
Na Num
üìç Direcci√≥n: C. de la Libertad, 8
Aterriza en la capital Na Num desde Buenos Aires. Un coreano con personalidad propia, a su manera, de estilo contempor√°neo y mestizo y con una propuesta gastron√≥mica insuperable.
La base es cocina coreana sin delimitar, mezclada con diferentes recetas sin frontera cultural. Sabores sorprendentes y texturas notables son los que hace de Na Num, el coreano de referencia de la capital.
Chikinmos
üìç Direcci√≥n: Calle del General D√≠az Porlier, 38
Chikinmos es un restaurante especializado en pollo frito y otras tapas coreanas, y es que, dentro de la cultura gastron√≥mica coreana, el pollo frito es una de las recetas m√°s de moda.
Un plato sencillo y delicioso, que podr√°s potenciar con diferentes salsas y saborear la Corea m√°s aut√©ntica y callejera. El pollo es de origen gallego entregado cada d√≠a y marinado m√°s de 12 horas para que sea jugoso. Lo sirven deshuesado en generosos trozos o como alitas.
Luke
üìç Direcci√≥n: Calle B√°rbara de Braganza, 2
El resultado de la aclamada propuesta gastron√≥mica de Luke Jang, el insuperable chef coreano, un desconocido sello de identidad en la capital. De dise√±o sofistica, Luke se divido en dos espacios diferenciados: La Barra, m√°s informal y estilo callejero, y La Cocina Abierta, donde disfrutar de una aut√©ntica cocina de autor.
En La Barra podr√°s disfrutar de diferentes tapas coreanas a la carta, entre ellas, la Gilda Coreana, temakis coreanos, arroz coreano‚Ä¶ En cambio, en La Cocina Abierta descubrir√°s un men√∫ degustaci√≥n cuyos platos son finalizados frente al cliente.
Revuelto
üìç Direcci√≥n: C. de V√≠ctor Hugo, 5
Disfruta de los sandwiches estilo coreano, un plato t√≠pico de Corea del Sur. En la carta s√≥lo encontrar√°s cinco sandwiches, todos ellos con pan de molde s√∫per esponjoso y revuelto de huevos camperos en su interior.
Nuestros favoritos son el Bacon Cheese, el cual contiene queso, bacon, ali-ol√≠ picante y salsa sweet mayo y el Trufa, que incorpora champi√±ones laminados, partisano, salsa de trufa y sweet mayo.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Boeing Workers Strike: Production Halted Amid Labor Dispute | Headlines
text: Boeing Workers Strike: Production Halted Amid Labor Dispute Boeing‚Äôs U.S. West Coast factory workers initiated a strike after rejecting a contract proposal, halting production of its key jets. The strike, Boeing‚Äôs first since 2008, adds to the company‚Äôs woes amid regulatory scrutiny, stock declines, and severe financial strain due to heavy debts. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Updated: 13-09-2024 14:53 IST | Created: 13-09-2024 14:53 IST Boeing's U.S. West Coast factory workers walked off the job early on Friday, rejecting a contract deal and halting production of its best-selling jets as the company faces severe delays and heavy debt. This marks the first strike since 2008, occurring amid mounting scrutiny from U.S. regulators following a recent incident involving a 737 MAX jet. The crises have hit Boeing's stock, falling 4% in U.S. pre-market trading on Friday and down 38% since early 2024. New CEO Kelly Ortberg, brought in to restore confidence, had proposed a 25% wage increase over four years, far less than the 40% workers demanded. The rejected deal included a $3,000 signing bonus and a promise to build Boeing's next commercial jet in the Seattle area. Roughly 30,000 members of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers voted to strike after rejecting the contract, demanding respect and fair wages. The strike poses multiple challenges, including financial impacts and production delays. Analysts predict a long strike could severely impact both Boeing and airlines reliant on its jets. (With inputs from agencies.)
